data.title: Alter RGBA in blits.
Variables in "translate python" blocks participate in rollback
data.body:
```
translate None python:
    test = "None"

translate english python:
    test = "english"

label start:

    "[_preferences.language] -> [test]"
    "Change the language here, then roll back."

    return
```

While the variable _does_ technically change between statements, it seems counterintuitive that it would revert to a value associated with a language we're no longer in.

data.title: u'adjust_spacing' is not a keyword argument or valid child for the text statement.
data.body:
```
File "game/dca_actor.rpy", line 277: u'adjust_spacing' is not a keyword argument or valid child for the text statement.
    text message adjust_spacing False vertical True
```

data.title: Vertical text doen't render at the display resolution
data.body: When vertical is True, text is blurry in full screen mode.

data.title: Developer option for image frames.
data.body: http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=36286#p397380

data.title: Do not confirm quit from the main menu.
Nestled CTC not being displayed after load
data.body:
```
define e = Character('Eileen', color="#c8ffc8", ctc = Solid("#F00", xsize = 20, ysize = 20), ctc_position = "nestled")
define e2 = Character('Eileen', color="#c8ffc8", ctc = Solid("#F00", xsize = 20, ysize = 20, xalign = 0.98, yalign = 0.95), ctc_position = "fixed")

label start:

    e "Nestled CTC."
    e2 "Fixed CTC."

    return
```

When loading at the first line, the CTC is not displayed as expected, but it _is_ when loading from the second line. Not sure if this is related to the other load issue, but this also doesn't seem to affect 6.99.7.

data.title: Odd behavior when loading at a line with {w} tags.
data.body:
```
label start:
    "Line 1{w}\nLine 2{w}\nLine 3"
    return
```

If you save and load the game here, it will immediately display:

```
Line 1
Line 2
Line 3
```

and then clicking will cause it to display:

```
Line 1
Line 2
```

as if continuing from the first `{w}`. After that, it proceeds as normal. This does not seem to affect 6.99.7, but it does affect the current 6.99.8 pre-release and most recent nightly.

data.title: Positional arguments with DynamicImage (Feature request)
data.body: Using DynamicImage, we can define images like: image eileen = "eileen [mood]" The problem is, this means manually updating the variable used, which can be messy and repetitive. label start: $ mood = 'happy' eileen "I'm happy!" $ mood = 'angry' eileen "I'm angry!" $ mood = 'happy' eileen "I'm happy again!" $ mood = 'angry' eileen "Nope, still angry!" Usually in renpy, we'd be able to use who arguments to change images. label start: eileen happy "I'm happy!" eileen angry "I'm angry!" eileen happy "I'm happy again!" eileen angry "Nope, still angry!" Naturally this won't work with dynamic images, since the arguments are mapped to variables which need updating. My idea to overcome this is to include optional indices in the dynamic image statement, resolving them from last to first. image eileen = "eileen [0:pose] [1:mood]" label start: $pose = 'standing' eileen happy "I'm happy!" #happy maps to 1, the last index, and pose is already set eileen standing sad "...Not." #sad maps to 1, and standing maps to 0 This would retain compatibility with existing dynamic images, but also allow for more flexibility going forward, allowing someone to effectively use one "image" statement per character while also allowing for the traditional dialogue image swapping syntax.

data.body:
Ren'Py version 6.99.8.945:

``` python
                if box_wrap and remheight - sh - padding <= 0:
                    maxx, maxy = layout_line(line, 0, target_height - y, 0)
```

in layout.rpy passes an extra argument to layout_line...

data.title: Configuration variables for audio volumes
data.body: I would like to have something like this, not sure if the "set_volume" code syntax is correct ;)

data.title: Exception in launcher preferences menu on latest nightly
data.body: Looks like it's probably caused by 150ac90e80c3d4a12e98f67c88931cb5bb58f4c4 adding None to the list of known languages?

data.title: Improvements to the extract dialogue system.
data.body:
It now offers the option to strip tags or not (instead of that being the default), escape special characters, and export translatable strings in addition to the dialogue.

As a side note, because this is code I've written for a MangaGamer project, I'd appreciate it if you could credit them alongside me wherever you credit contributors, should you choose to accept this.

data.title: Add a PushMove transition.
data.body:
This adds a new transition type, which causes the new scene to "push" the old scene off the screen in one of four directions. It's basically just a special case of CropMove--a combination of a slide in and a slide out applied simultaneously. I couldn't think of a nice way to do it with the tools available, so I made it its own transition, which I thought other people might find useful.

As a side note, because this is code I've written for a MangaGamer project, I'd appreciate it if you could credit them alongside me wherever you credit contributors, should you choose to accept this.

data.title: Added argument to QuickLoad() to control confirm prompt
data.body: So that you can quickload a file without having the load confirm prompt show up. I intend to make all prompts optional for my next game so this was a necessary change for me, and it's a convenient option for other devs who might want to do the same.

data.title: Maximize broken in  gnome
"translate None python" blocks not being executed after a reload
data.body:
```
init 0:
  translate None python:
    test = "We're in Japanese."
  translate english python:
    test = "We're in English."

label start:
  "[test]"
  return
```

It works when you first run the game, as you'd expect, but after a reload, `test` is no longer defined if you're currently in the `None` language. `test` _is_ properly defined if you're in the `english` language, though. (I realize this is a silly example and not something anyone would actually do, but it was the simplest way I could think of to demonstrate the issue.)

data.title: Enforce minimum framerate?
data.body: This is only really relevant for games that make use of Steam integration, but it would be nice if there were some way to enforce a minimum framerate. The Steam overlay is tied to your framerate, so if you try to open it up when the game's idling at 4~5fps, it looks really choppy (and sometimes won't even pop up at all).

data.title: A default_transform is lost over a reload.
data.body: This is because the param_target of an image reference is recomputed whenever the image reference is reloaded, but it's what stores the old xpos, ypos, etc.

data.title: Character images not showing
data.body:
When using show, character images are not showing on screen. 
They appear after refreshing with SHIFT+R.

Example code here: http://pastebin.com/DUQvHRWx
